intro: Exacum quinquenervium subsp. linearifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaved African violet, is a species native to tropical Africa. It is a flowering plant characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The leaves are elongated and linear, giving it a distinct appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. This subspecies is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
